title: So if Nexus Blitz is being considered for a permanent game mode, why not Dominion?
body:
Honestly, if you guys had put **half** the effort into saving Dominion that you put into making Nexus Blitz into what it is, **we'd still have Dominion**.

The mode was fun and had tons of potential, and it would have probably retained a decent player base if you hadn't abandoned it entirely.

Don't get me wrong, I loved dominion and all, it was just so "clunky" and didn't fit the dynamic of League of Legends.

It was a CTF type map in a MOBA game, and really the only champions that were viable in it were shit like Shaco and Twitch. People would literally just play to capture altars instead of fighting eachother. Imagine trying to play Illaoi in that map, exactly, you wouldn't. 

Nexus Blitz is dominion 2.0 because you're fighting for objectives in a 3v3-esk map, being because it's so small, but it's 5v5. It takes around 30 seconds to roam from top to bottom and you can run into an enemy champion at any point of the game while jungling. 

Obviously, they're not exactly the same, but it most cases, they are.

Sure it was different from SR and TT and ARAM, but that's what made it fun and unique and entertaining. Heck, Heroes of the Storm has a Dominion-esque map in the form of Towers of Doom, so if Blizzard can do it then why can't Riot (outside of laziness and half-baked excuses as to why they wouldn't update the mode of course)?

P.S. I also played DnD and didn't enjoy it as games were pretty much decided by the very first team fight around the center objective and rarely had back and forth gameplay if at all.

I think that they should make ascension permanent. If they decide to bring Dominion back they need to tweak it because so many people are rallying for Dominion back but they are just going to ignore it after a while.

Let’s face it: Dominion’s problems came not from neglect but from its core design. It was incredibly monotonous; all you did was capture points and teamfight. That’s all there was to it. SR has different roles and all sorts of complex situations. ARAM keeps you on your toes with the chaotic randomness of the champion picks. Even TT is more exciting than dominion since it’s basically diet SR. A game of Dominion was nothing more than rinse and repeat. The only way they could’ve fixed that was to rework into something else.

I get it; some of you enjoyed it. However, what I described is just not what League is or was ever supposed to be. It catered to an audience that was largely not present in the LoL fan base because again, Dominion is the black sheep of game modes. It’s repetitive and predictable while the others have some aspect that make them more exciting. I’m sorry, but Riot’s not going to waste money on a mode that flopped.
